Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Microcin L (MccL, natural AMPs; class 2a microcins, bacteriocins, Gram-negative bacteria, prokaryotes, BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: Escherichia coliLR05, human microbiota:gut, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: The C-terminal 13 residues are identical to MccV (AP01228). Like MccV, MccL has a S-S bond between C78 and C89. However, one additional S-S bond can form between residues C29 and C33.  MOA: It targets bacterial membranes and induces ion channel formation, leading to the disruption of the proton-motive force and hence ATP production.
Literature Information.Author: Pons AM, Delalande F, Duarte M, Benoit S, Lanneluc I, Sabl√© S, Van Dorsselaer A, Cottenceau G.2004
Literature Information.Title: Genetic analysis and complete primary structure of microcin L.
